statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Marquette 70, Northern Michigan 58
article.story: MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Even after three wins in four days, Tom Crean wasn't very excited with the play of his Marquette team. "We're not executing the way we should against the zone," Crean said. "The good news is we got three wins." Travis Diener scored 15 points and Steve Novak added 14 to lead No. 23 Marquette to a 70-58 victory over Northern Michigan on Monday night. Scott Merritt added 12 points and 11 rebounds for the Golden Eagles, who improved to 4-0 and ran their all-time record against Northern Michigan to 9-0. Crean wants to drill his team hard because it is still struggling offensively, especially against a tough zone like the one the Wildcats used against his young club. But with Marquette's defense limiting Northern Michigan to 42-percent shooting (21-of-50), and its taller players forging a 46-21 rebound advantage, it didn't matter that the Golden Knights struggled a bit against the Division II Wildcats (2-1). Northern Michigan was led by Ricky Volcy's 14 points and Marco Volcy's 12. "That was a pretty good effort. I think we battled as much as we could," Northern Michigan Coach Dean Ellis said. Ellis decided to use a zone defense against Marquette because the Eagles appeared to have trouble against it in their season-opening win over St. John's. The plan worked for a while. "Early in the game, they really had trouble scoring," Ellis said. Eventually, Marquette got going and pulled away. Reserve guard Dameon Mason played a big role. After Matt LePage made a pair of free throws with 12:15 left to cut the Wildcats' deficit to five points at 44-39, Marquette scored 12 straight points. Mason had the first five and Marquette pushed its lead to 56-39. Northern Michigan never got that close again. "We seemed kind of not into it tonight," Mason said. "I tried to come off the bench and give them some spark." Crean admitted his players might have been a little tired after having only a day to recuperate from back-to-back games Friday and Saturday in their Blue and Gold tournament. But the coach said that wasn't an excuse for poor play. He will try to rectify that with a hard week of practice before next Monday's home game against Notre Dame.
